description: APPLICATION FOR A LAWFUL DEVELOPMENT CERTIFICATE IN RESPECT OF THE PROPOSED CONVERSION OF GARAGE INTO HABITABLE ROOM AND ERECTION OF CAR PORT
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The conversion of the garage into a habitable room would consist of a non-material alteration to the external appearance of the building within the meaning of Section 55 (2) Town & Country Planning Act 1990 and the (General Permitted Development) (Amendment) (No. 2) (England) Order 2008 "the Order" and would therefore not constitute development as defined in Section 55 (2) and the relevant parts of the Act.

Condition : 2 - The proposed car port would comprise operations falling within the meaning of Class E of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in Class E. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.
Condition : 3 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 100, 19418/01, 05, 06, 07 and 08

Condition : 4 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner. In this instance the application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
